title: Clytie - lingering attention to her father's face

content.question: In the beginning of the sixth paragraph to the end of the seventh paragraph ("Without . . . mouth") the description of Clytie’s lingering attention to her father’s face suggests her

choices.label: growing realization of his impending death
remorse about her past lack of concern for him
disgust at his gaunt and deathly appearance
repressed antagonism for the years he neglected her

content.answer: growing realization of his impending death

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain the function of a character changing or remaining unchanged.
